intro: Rhopalocnemis phalloides, commonly known as the giant false shield bug, is a species of true bug native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rhopalocnemidae and is characterized by its elongated, shield-shaped body covered in a waxy, pale green to yellowish exoskeleton. The plant it inhabits, typically woody shrubs or trees, provides both shelter and a source of moisture. Its feeding habits involve piercing and sucking plant tissues, which can cause damage to the host plant. This species is of interest to entomologists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
